titles: A journey to Scotland giving a character of that country, the people and their manners. By an English gentleman. With a letter from an officer there, and a poem on the same subject.
author: Ward, Edward, 1667-1731.
Cleveland, John, 1613-1658. Rebel Scot. aut
date: printed in the year M DC XC IX. [1699]
notes: "English gentleman" = Edward Ward; attribution from Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Caption title on p. 3: A character of Scotland.
Poem on pp. 14-16 has caption title: "The rebel Scot"; copy cataloged has MS. attribution on p. 14: "By Cleaveland" [i.e. John Cleveland, 17th century poet].
Copy has stained title page and considerable print show-through.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Scotland --  Description and travel --  Early works to 1800.
Scotland --  History --  17th century --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
